subtitle.text: Penetrant Testing (PT) is a highly sensitive method for detecting surface discontinuities not visible to the human eye. It can be used on wide range of materials at low cost. Portable equipment allows the inspector to test on complex shapes at hard to reach locations or remote field. PT can be applied to cover 100% of the surface of parts by immersion.

Dexon PT training covers the theoretical aspects of this technique as well as providing practical demonstrations and hands-on experience time for students by highly experienced NDT technicians. Penetrant Testing training courses satisfy the training hours needed for Level I/II certification in accordance with ASNT standards and practices (SNT-TC-1A).

Magnetic Particle Testing is used to locate discontinuities in ferromagnetic parts using electrically induced magnetism. MT is a very effective inspection tool sensitive to both surface and subsurface flaw localizing. MT can be done fairly fast and at low cost to almost any size and shaped part.

These courses cover the theoretical aspects of this method and also provide demonstrations and practical hands-on laboratory time using both portable and stationary equipment. The course meets ASNT standards and practices (SNT-TC-1A).

Ultrasonic testing is applicable to nearly all solid materials like steel, aluminium and even plastics. It will allow you to detect laminations within the material or discontinuities in plates, welds and forgings, all generally done from one side of the part. Results are generated instantly and you can easily assess the condition of your equipment while inspecting.

Dexon Training Institute will teach you the theoretical aspects of this method, and also provides demonstrations and practical hands-on laboratory time using portable equipment. The course meets ASME V and AWS D1.1 code and ASNT standards and practices (SNT-TC-1A).

Using ultrasonic instruments and methods approved by the American Society for Non-destructive Testing provides accurate measurements of your equipment. Almost all solid materials can be measured by easy techniques, letting you have control on the condition of your equipment done by fairly quick inspection methods.

Dexon Training Institute will teach you the theoretical aspects of this method, and also provides demonstrations and practical hands-on laboratory time using portable equipment. The course meets ASNT standards and practices (SNT-TC-1A).

Visual inspection is the most used method when performing manufacturing and field inspection. A trained inspector can assess a multitude of potential problem areas, assisted by devices quantifying, qualifying and magnifying the conditions. Letting your inspectors perform these inspections can help your equipment provide a longer service life and save money on shut downs.

VT training at Dexon Training Institute provides you with highly skilled and experienced teachers with theoretical understanding and case studies. You will learn how to conduct the VT and assess the results as by ASNT standards and practice (SNT-TC-1A).

Eddy current techniques allows for instantaneous interpretation on both wall thickness and discontinuities in conductive material. The inspection is harmless to both inspector and material allowing for safe testing. ECT can also be used on surfaces with high temperature as it is a non-contact method.

Training ECT at our facilities provide you with highly skilled and experienced teachers with hands on practical training as well as theoretical understanding. You will learn how to use the equipment for ECT at our NDT laboratories as by ASNT standards and practice (SNT-TC-1A).

Radiographic Testing makes use of X-rays or gamma rays produced by a radioactive isotope. The basic principle of radiographic inspection is the same as that for medical radiography. Penetrating radiation is passed through a solid object, in this case a weld or a plate rather that part of the human body, onto a photographic film, resulting in an image of the objectâ€™s internal structure being deposited on the film. The amount of energy absorbed by the object depends on its thickness and density. A trained inspector can detected all discontinuities by viewing shape and variation in density of the processed film.

Dexon Training Institute will teach you the theoretical aspects of this method, and also provides demonstrations and practical hands-on laboratory time using ASME V, AWS D1.1 code and ASNT standards and practices (SNT-TC-1A).

API training programs aimed at engineers and technicians to give a high knowledge on codes and standards set by API, ASME and other acclaimed associations. We offer API 579 Fitness For Service (FFS) and API 1163 Pipeline pigging, In-Line Inspection (ILI) & integrity assessment. All courses are held by trainers with many years of experience and excellent tutoring skills.
These courses will let your inspectors able to conduct assessment of your process equipment to help you determine the need of service and operating conditions.

At Dexon Training Institute we can give you and your staff basic ASNT level 3 training to let your inspectors in one or more NDT methods. This course allows personnel qualification and certification for basic level 3 examination.
The course program per SNT-TC-1A to ensure full understanding of the standards and practices set by ASNT.

Advanced ultrasonic testing techniques are in high demand for inspection of industrial plants. Dexon Training Institute will gladly assist in providing advanced NDT courses to transfer the knowledge of Dexon Inspection Services, in particular Phased Array Ultrasonic Testing (PAUT).

Other advanced NDT techniques can be offer also upon request for now, but we aim to provide a wide course program in the near future. We offer highly skilled advanced NDT trainers with broad practical and theoretical knowledge gained over many years and from our own Dexon Research Department.

Our courses lets you gain either a formal NDT qualification or according to client needs, such as training for managers and design engineers or for quality assurance / quality control (QA/QC) personnel to interpret and review NDT inspection results.
We offer NDT courses in accordance with the recommended practices of the American Society for Nondestructive Testing (SNT-TC-1A).

Dexon Training Institute provides professional exam preparation for API courses aimed at engineers and technicians. All courses are held by trainers with many years of experience and excellent tutoring skills. The courses will help your company keep a sound safety culture to meet the codes and standards expected from your customers. A certification examination will give you a high level of safety to make sure your equipment can sustain a long life of service.

sublist.text: is one of the most popular certifications within the petrochemical industry as it is highly recommended practice for maintenance inspections. Following these codes isnâ€™t just being a advised practice, but also a highly cost saving investment.

is often taken in combination with the API 510 courses as they are very relevant to each other. API trained inspectors will help you remain control of your equipment for continuous processing and a high level of safety for both personnel and equipment.

has become an important instrument and preferred risk inspection method within the industry. API 580 certification allows the inspector to assess pressure vessels, piping and heat exchangers to develop prioritized inspection plans based on HSE and damage mechanisms (DM).

provides the inspector with thorough knowledge on codes and standards to assess above ground storage tanks for service, repair, rating and alterations. The course was made by owners/users of the tanks to ensure a longer, safer service life for the equipment and is the expected industry standard today.
sublist.list_title: The program benefits employers and the industry as a whole by helping to:

list.text: improve management control of process unit operation, repair, rerating, alteration and maintenance
reduce the potential for inspection delays
provide a continued high level of safety through the use of highly specialized and experienced inspectors
keep your equipment within the codes and standards set by API, ASME and other acclaimed associations

subtitle.text: Rope Access Training allow you to safely conduct your work with very little implication to running process or other work being done in difficult areas. It is both time and cost saving as it is easy to set up and allows for quick access with a Dexon trained Rope Access technician. Rope Access Training certification can be used for a wide variation of businesses, and we are ready to tailor our training for your company requirements.Dexon Training Institute is IRATA (International Rope Access Training Association) approved and conduct rope access training at our new training facilities in Ban Chang. We have highly skilled and certified instructors and assessors to make sure you get the best training available.IRATA training pre-requisites

subtext.text: Minimum 1000 hours and 12 months of experience at L 1
Minimum 1000 hours and 12 months of experience at L 2

list.text: Assessment by independent IRATA assessor : 1 day
Lunches provided by the training company

subtitle.text: B31.3 is one of ASMEâ€™s most popular codes, widely adopted by jurisdictions worldwide. The course is an essential reference for anyone engaged with piping. Application of the B31.3 codes will help users to comply with applicable regulations within their jurisdictions, while achieving the operational, cost and safety benefits to be gained from the many industry best-practices detailed in this course.

This course provides a comprehensive coverage of the ASME B31.3 design, fabrication, examination and testing requirements. It has been completely revised, reorganized and updated, and includes descriptions of important new requirements of ASME B31.3.

sublist.title: ASME IX: Understanding and application of the codes

subtitle.text: In present, welding plays as the important role in the construction of boiler, pipe line, gas and oil pipe line, refinery plant, petrochemical plant and general assembly. This course explains how the code organizes and covers the general references and guides that apply to procedure and performance qualifications such as positions, type and purpose of various mechanical tests, acceptance criteria, and applicability of section IX. In addition the participants will be able to create and interpret the PQR, WPS and WPQ welding qualification. This course will be helpful for the students who are responsible of the construction, fabrication, erection and repair.

With the rapid growth and continued expansion of renewable energies Dexon Inspection Services are taking steps to position themselves as the Asia Regionâ€™s leading provider of Wind Turbine Repair and Maintenance services.

course.text: This 5 days training course is designed for understanding various Codes and Standard like ASME Sec VIII, ASME Sec II, ASME Sec IX, ASNT, API and SSPC. It helps the participants to get prepare for API SIFE Certification Examination.

The API SIFE Source Inspector Fixed Equipment certification exam tests the applicantâ€™s core knowledge in relevant standards/codes, inspection reference documents, source inspection practices, manufacturing processes, and inspection tools and methods. The focus of the exam is on source inspection issues and activities rather than design or engineering knowledge contained in the reference standards.

The API Source Inspector certification program was developed in cooperation with industry experts. It qualifies individuals (employees of end-users and individual contractors) who perform the important task of supplier quality surveillance.

course_list.text_title: The Source Inspector has been defined as the individual responsible for:

course_list.text: Examining fabricated and manufactured equipment and materials at a supplierâ€™s facility
Confirming that the supplierâ€™s quality management system is being utilized effectively

day.title: Day 1-5
day.day: Teaching following body of knowledge for API SIFE and Provide all essential knowledge tha need to pass the exam.

course.text: The course is based on API RP 580 Risk-Based Inspection and API Publication 581, Base Resource Document. The course first explains feasible means and alternatives for achieving a successful RBI program without undue complications.

This course deals with RBI framework and methodology in a simple straight forward manner to establish and implement a risk-based inspection program best suited for the company objectives. Its utility is based on the premise that a few vital equipmentâ€™s in a process plant contribute a majority of the risk. Consequently, if these few equipmentâ€™s can be identified, then testing and inspection can be focused on them rather than several low-risk items. RBI helps to prioritize their equipment for inspection, optimize inspection methods and frequencies, and develop effective inspection plan commensurate with the risk contribution and equipment condition.

The course is focused on methodology of actual implementation of RBI in Oil and Gas industry. It covers advanced knowledge of RBI implementation in addition to the knowledge required for passing the Certification Examination. The candidates should possess at least one certification out of API 510, API 570 or API 653 certifications.

day.title: Day 1-5
day.day: Teaching following body of knowledge for API 580 and Provide all essential knowledge tha need to pass the exam.

course.text: This course is based on damage mechanisms in refining, petrochemical and other process industries. It focuses not only on different materials properties and process fluid characteristics but also on different processes environment parameters which leads to damage mechanisms. They can be interdependent and cause damage mechanisms to initiate, propagate individually or simultaneously.

The course also contains the useful information like material selection, design considerations, operations, necessary to determine the causes of damages/ deterioration present and probable inspection. Various examination and testing methods, other techniques for determining the type size and location of damage mechanisms, monitoring or mitigation techniques for each damage mechanism also will be explained with case studies.

day.title: Day 1-5
day.day: Teaching following body of knowledge of API 571 and Provide all essential knowledge tha need to pass the exam.

course.text: BST is Basic Safety Training
This course will support your basic for working on wind turbines.

course_list.text: Working at height

Fire awareness
First aid

course.text: ART is Advanced Rescue Training

This standard controls the risks associated with rescue operations, ensuring a more efficient rescue operation from a wind turbine. The training elevates rescuer self-reliance and enables successful transport of a colleague who cannot self-evacuate, to an assembly point until professional emergency responders arrive.

day_list.text: Rescue from Hub,Spiner and inside blade
